intro: Gochnatia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Gochnatia angustifolia is often used in traditional Aboriginal medicine for its potential healing properties.
